comments.body: Maybe there's multiple per-level. like in obsidian pinnacle, there's the backroad theme and the arch illager boss theme, so two music discs to collect.
Love this idea. I think it be cooler if they were added as hidden secrets for each lvl
Or you get it by defeating 100% of mobs, 100% of chests, smth like that maybe, that'd be cool

Wow! Incredible idea! And, what if all the discs are songs that are connected (like a puzzle) and if you put it in the correct order, you unlock something special! Like a skin, a secret scene, a character, a gear, a weapon, or just an archivment! Really good idea yo'!

Should not be unlocked on first clear, but be a random unlock, maybe through a chest in the level, so that it gives people a bit more to do. Love collecting music myself, and would like grinding for stuff like that.
you can even bring back old ones like cat,mall,etc or make brand new ones. this maybe also found in the house.

Totaly aggre, I think it would be really cool to have music disc to play at camp. Maby all the music discs from normal minecraft including the new in 1.16 and some new ones in minecraft dungeons would be sweet!

I've turned the music off completely.  It was just too much like elevator music.  Gimme a choice of music tracks if you want me to listen.  I liked Rord of the Lings just as much as the next guy but I don't wanna hear those kinda tunes NoN stop.  Can we get som Mick n Rorty...?  lol
I think it'd be better to put it in a secret area in the level because you already get a reward after completing levels.

I like this idea, and maybe once you get all of the discs from the storyline, you could get a cosmetic option on the dancer's sword and harp crossbow, that lets you play music from the discs and choose which music to play when using them in game.
I like that idea
but what about the opening cinematic, The end portal cinematic, and all unused music? (the closing cinematic goes with obsidian pinnacle)
Great idea!
Maybe you can lern cretain dances for certain songs.
This could be done through a payment of Gems at a certain place to disenchant a piece of equipment, leaving the base item, returning enchantment points and removing emeralds

There is a way for you to test new items without salvaging the old one, and here's how to do it.

  1. First equip all the items you want to test, don't do anyting about the old ones, just leave them in your inventory
  2. Log out to character selection
  3. Clone your character
  4. This clone will inherit all the equipped items, but nothing in inventory
  5. All enchanting points assigned to items that were on items in the inventory of the original character will be refunded for the clone
  6. Enchant the items on the cloned character and test them
  7. Decide what to do before logging back to the original character
Agreed 398461790632.  It's pretty common in games to pay in-game currency in order to respec things.

I think they could make enchantment points a max when equipped too. So like, if I am level 50 and have 50 points, that means I can only equip gear with a max of 50 total. That way, I can carry different gear and swap them when I want.. I like having a collection of nice uniques and want to be able to use them when I feel like. It wouldn't create any balancing issues, and the game is more fun when you can switch your playstyle for a while without losing the old one.
You know an easy way to do it is to add the grindstone to minecraft dungeons.
Guys, you do understand they left all of these features out, intentionally, and will not be added into the game.
I think part of the problem here is that it's very hard to compare loot. Everything should be provided in terms of DPS so that I know exactly how much damage I can do.

398407014632 Your probably right, but we can still try and convince them to add it. If the idea became popular enough and have some good way to be added to the game, then I don't see why wouldn't they add it.

I understand that being able to switch enchantments points would be a little bit OP, but we can add limits to it by making it that you need to pay emeralds to disenchant the items, which will make emeralds more useful.
It would also make it more fun to play and much easier to try different tactics. Right now, not having the ability to disenchant items is limiting us and making it harder for us to try different things.

Though, I appreciate that we can clone our character which makes it possible to try a lot of things. But I wouldn't make it an excuse to not add a way to disenchant items. Note that I don't recommend cloning your character right now with all the bugs.
Or at the very least, the ability in the camp to do test enchantments to determine if what you want will work before spending points on it.
IT'S SO ANOYING YOU ARE SO SMART, MOGANG STUDIOS, TAKE NOTE!

I want to use different gear and/or different enchants when I'm playing solo vs in a group, without having to mess with cloning back and forth. I'm also afraid that I'm going to get bored if I can't change up my play style whenever I want.

Your suggestion would be the simplest fix.  All of your points are right on target.  I'd add that, on top of the set back when a new piece of gear doesn't live up the promise, there can definitely be some emotional distress at the situation that may put you off playing for a while.  Game designers should go out of their way to avoid eliciting that type of emotion from their players. (unless its a souls type game I suppose, then double down on the soul-crushing weariness...)

The combat dummies are not nearly enough of a tool to evaluate equipment, particularly without the items being enchanted while testing.  I'll create a separate post with a suggestion for more robust combat dummy functionality.

Fully agree. The current enchantment system discourages experimenting with different gears and enchantments. As a result, I haven't tried many of the different enchantments at all. The clone feature is questionable and extremely bothersome just to try out different gear and build. Any progress made on the clone and not your main character will be deleted anyway.

Grindstone in camp or wathever to remove enchantments, cost in emerald. Loot based enchantments so players can makes builds. Adding an enchanter to camp, cost in emerald to put on gears. Gears levels tells how many enchantments you can put on. More emeralds drop.
there should be an undo button for it yes.
Add a Grindstone to camp

I think a re roll enchant would be really cool as well, in normal Minecraft I just enchant at table then disenchant at grindstone and it changes enchants, but maybe in dungeons the blacksmith has another option to re roll enchantments on an item.
With the addition of new merchants, players can now give items to the blacksmith, who will remove all of the enchantment points, then return the item to you after three completed levels.
I like this idea but I think that it should cost some emeralds to disenchant and you hire a villager to disenchant for you
You can already do this with the Blacksmith Villager Shop when you upgrade your items.
all you have to do to get rid of enchants is give it to the blacksmith.
Maybe this could be done through the blacksmith- they add a new tab: the Grindstone. It would allow you to pay a small price to get the enchantments off of your items, and return the points

I collect uniques, so having this feature would be a LIVESAVER. The amount of times I've had to spend an UNGODLY amount of emeralds to upgrade something JUST for the enchantment points, is unbearable.

 

pls mojang
use a grind stone
Maybe a feature which lowers the power level of the item by 2 or 3 every time you re-roll
This would be a great idea as I wouldn't have to salvage every single item I get until I get my specific enchantment that I want in Minecraft Dungeons.
It could be a Priest villager you earn in camp by beating a place like soggy swamp.
I think that's a good idea, however, I don't think it should be free.  Maybe it should cost an enchantment point.
I'd also like this as a feature because I have the absolute worst luck.

Having this cost an enchantment point could be interesting because of increasing xp costs per enchantment level. It could make mid-game much more valuable and worth investing in instead of rushing to end game and getting bored by grinding immediately. I'm not sure if it would be a good idea to take just an enchantment point or if it would take both an enchantment point and reduce your player level accordingly, but I think it would be most interesting if it were the latter.
getting the right 3 enchants on a unique item seems impossible. If you could spend 1 enchantment point or something to re-roll, would be awesome

i don't think it should be exp because in my experience you get a level around once per stage which is around 30 minutes so you get one re-roll every 30 minutes and that is not being spent on gear. so ether a new currency or lots and lots of emeralds. I also think that it does not work on weapons that are enchanted (or without some cost to it) . I see it as when you enchant a weapon it becomes part of you in a way as it's your levels and (because trading does not exist in this game) only you can use it.

1. It would save us dungeoneers a lot of time if we are given somehow an ability to reroll enchantments! Perhaps it would cost 10k emralds or a rare drop from a specific mob, maybe even after completing a super hard level. Grinding for the right weapon consume(s) days or perhaps even weeks to finally get, let alone farming for the right weapon and the right enchantments at that. (Which usually just discourages me and the people I play with to feel no need to grind the game out just because of how time consuming it can be).
maybe it would cost x3 the sell value of the item and if there are enchantments on it it would still reroll but you lose the enchantment points used
Yes yes a million times Yes. this would be valueble. they already have one that rerolls the power on items. it would make since to get a friendly witch or a liberarian to reroll enchants.

I was thinking about how they could give more options to spend enchantment points as I am now level 250 so nothing to spend them on.

I think a better way to implement this idea, player pays 5 enchantment points which would allow you to purchase an extra slot option and 10 points for a second enchantment option to an existing slot. This would mean a maxed out weapon would still only have 3 different enchantments slots but each slot could have up to 5 enchantment options to choose from.

When the item is gifted or sold enchantment points spent are returned an item gets reset.

if the item is put in the blacksmith and re-enchanted again by the same player the enchantment options should not change. Using the blacksmith should not allow you to endlessly swap out enchantment options

Why not use the Splatoon system where when you reroll, the current slots will reroll (if you only have 5 filled, only those 5 can reroll). The current enchantment will drop as enchant fragments. If you get 10 enchant fragments you can the make it replace a current slot or an empty slot.

The payment can be:
-2000 emerald
-the new gold ingot from the Nether update
-gilded gears
-unique + emeralds

I don't suggest payment via enchant points because the amount of xp needed for 1 enchant point increases as you level up.

P/S: payment via gears should also increase the odds of the enchantment of the sacrificed gear to appear on the rerolled gear. That way we have some control over the chance.

1. Good idea but I have a better idea to get for The End Update like adding the Enchater (Merchant) And It can be located where abandoned portal is and also it can be unlocked in Apocalypse + ,Also this Merchant can replace enchantments from ur trash weapons that u don't use but it may caust (if is a Common is 6 enchantment points and if is Powerful is 12 enchaments points ) 1,000 emeralds per replace (reroll).And u must go 5 missions to get what you ordered. Also this merchant can add enchantment slots by adding that you have on your weapons that you don't use but it will caust 2 enchantment points and 500 emeralds. Also this merchant can add up to 4 enchantment slots (Because every weapons starts with one enchantment slot so 1+4=5) And to get those slots go to Apocalypse +21 to get 4 slots and Apocalypse +42 to get 5 slots (Pls Mojang add Apocalypse +26 to Apocalypse +50)

This is nice and all, but with how many enchantments they're adding the RNG to getting what you want would just raise and becomes even more expensive.
I would prefer if there was a simple and clear way to get the enchantments you want without the hours upon hours to get just one item that you want and not to mention the many other items you want to get.
For example, putting a chance to successfully remove an enchantment from an item and putting it in another item would finally make it possible to try many different combinations without grinding for hours upon hours just to get one combination of enchantments and it's not even in the item you want.

Yeah this would be very handy I recently started a challenge where i could only use my Squid Coast sword but I got HORRIBLE!!! enchants so i really wanted to re roll them. Maybe he could be a Librarian or a Priest in Highblock Halls with all the books and stuff

I literally got my first piece of armor that has over 1000 added health (Titans Shroud) but the first enchantment slot has Flame focus or that defense boost one, but I want something like Refreshment or something of utility. I really need this to be a thing, but I think it should be post game for balancing reasons
That would be a great idea but it could be like a new villager in camp called the "enchanter"

I don't necessarily agree with this idea because re-doing dungeons and stages to get the equipment you want is a pretty big percent of this games activity and if you were able to just reroll what would you have to do in the game now after you get the gear you want?

I agree with this.

This is needed so bad! Many many times have I found the unique armor or weapon I wanted but the enchantments were really bad, so the item became completely unusable, just instant salvage.

Make it cost enchantment points and emeralds, for gilded it would cost gold too and everytime you reroll the item the cost would become higher.

This wouldn't guarantee that you would get perfect enchantments on your items, but it would certainly make it a hell alot less frustrating. I could see the cost being really high until you get the right enchantments, so it's still RNG but not as bad as it's right now.

If I don't get the enchantments I want on a unique I just use Cheat Engine to get the enchantments I want anyway, can't be bothered to farm for the same item for days hoping for it to roll the right enchantments, plus the gilded enchantment to be the right one too.

Also gilded enchantments should be able to be rerolled.
I feel it would be more appreciated in normal Minecraft with the use of copper to reroll the enchantments for items.

I think it should cost 10 levels/enchantment points. Some emeralds and some gold and will only be accessible when your apocalypse +15 or higher. I would love this as it would make one of my favourite games less of a grind
This is possible now via the enchantsmith.

Agree but I would make a wheel option with that, so you can change it fast when playing so you do not need to open inventory every time

That's from my post, because I did not see yours: 

Favorite weapons/wheel

A simple QOL future: You could favorite male weapons and when playing pressing a key/button would give you a wheel option to change weapon fast, that way you would not need to open inventory every time you want to change weapon. Maybe something similar for artifacts would not be bad either.
And it won't allow salvaging of those items
Tyralun agree, with that, they could also add option salvage all and it would literary salvage all items that are not selected as favorite.

Absolutely, I would call this locked item, but favorite makes since. :)
Mass salvage, and sorting items by name so artifacts are more easy to salvage etc.
they could also make it so you can sell all your not favorite items with the press of a botton

I also had this idea. My thought was to have a new tab labeled "favorites": if you have multiple sets and combinations of gear and artifacts, as favorites tab you save the time of trouble of having to scroll through all your melee weapons, armors, ranged weapons, and artifacts.
Pinning favorited items so they always stay on top of the inventory would be nice.

I fully agree, but I really need the ability to not accidentally drop or throw away a favorited item when I am cleaning out garbage inventory items like mined blocks. Some kind of compartmentalization of inventories might be nice, such as favorited items and auto-picked-up items. Help avoid accidentally throwing away your netherite hoe when dumping the excess dirt blocks youve been mining.

Also shields used by mobs will no longer break instantly when touched. Like what's the point of having a shield when touching it once instantly breaks it? Mobs should use shields better too. They could block every projectile, but cannot attack and block at the same time, so they're vulnerable when doing melee attacks.
Would there be a new shield spot in your interface?
Perhaps you give up the bow for one of the shields? Dunno how this would fit with quiver artifacts, though...

Yeah I would love that. Really felt that Shields are missing when my character is holding a one handed weapon.

Also Protection enchantment for shields too! or some passive Regenation enchantment or life steal would be nice.

I think Shields should replace bows/crossbows, so they use the same slot as bows/crossbows and you have to make a choice, do I want a shield to protect me more or do I want a bow to do some ranged firing? :D
like my own post about adding more armor slots, i feel like shields should be added too, and they should be able to give a good block chance and maybe even good chunk of Thorns.
Maybe a sheild could even be an artifact if they don't want to add it as an item type.

As for more armor slots, they should have had as many armor slots as vanilla minecraft has, would made sense too.

With only 1 armor slot they made the game so simple...

Maybe that would be too much work for them, they would have to change every armor to a chest plate and then add gauntlets, helmets, leggins, boots. But it would be worth it I think, would make the game much better.
This would add for more options when playing for sure.

Add a shield slot so that way it is part of your set up, and you don't have to lose using any items that you want to use.

Maybe add different types of shields.

Maybe they could replace the bow/projectile slot, and you have to choose what play style you'd prefer? Do you play as a beefy dude that gets in the thick of it, or do you hang back and do your pew pew action with the bow.
you could get rid one of the roll buttons for the shield
I got a big ass suggestion in the works, but I'm glad other people want to see shields in the game. If any of you want to see the Doc let me know I'd love for more opinions.
The best way to implement it would be a 1h/shield like the dual wield weapons. So there would be no new slot, kind of like a new weapon type

so it would take 1 hit, cooldown, then the player could use it again?

or maybe the sheild has its own hitpoints

Shields would be dropped in highblock halls, desert temple. Also highblock hall's should drop a unique shield from those armored vindacators.
It should be enchantable artifact.

I think this whole Shield idea is awsome and the anchantments would be super useful. Another idea is like their is more than one Shield, like maybe their is one that only protects blast protection and still keeps your speed normal. Or mor maybe when you roll your defense increases. Also different shields with different designs and abilities would be cool as well.
What about, instead of having a new slot, they replace the ranged weapon to balance them.
This would probably be an artifact.
I was thinking the exact same thing if would be awesome to have custom designed shields with partner such as the hero cape design
YES. YES YES. There is almost no way to avoid taking damage in Minecraft Dungeons, and shields might add real skill, and make the game more fun.

I was thinking about that too! But what slot should it be in? Should it replace the bow, or have its own slot?

Easy vote!
And these shields should be stronger than the mobs' shields.
And these shields should be stronger than the mobs' shields. And we should have a shield specific slot in normal minecraft that would be exclusively for shields.
we should make shields in Minecraft Dungeons for more protection.
Maybe like smaller than Ender-Dragon dragons that are mini-bosses that you have a small chance of taming if you feed it raveger meat a new thing that ravengers drop
Yes but like polar bears where they are territorial and stuff but are super hard to tame
It would be great to Hatch a dragon and have it as a fighting pet. Something stronger than a dog that can fly. It would fight those Phantoms.
I like dragons thx
There definitely needs to be a dragon pet, but I thing it should be a armour enchantment, or artefact.
Add it as an artifact like a dragon egg to hatch a baby dragon to help you fight
Minecraft Dungeons needs a dragon pet or boss
I think we should have an extra boss in the end, namely the ultra-ender dragon. For Lore implications, it would be cool to see actual ender dragons in Minecraft Dungeons and in actual Minecraft!
A new dragon for each dimension
Like as pets

PCPS4 SWITCH SWITCH
NS

Have the language as an option, yes.  But don't FORCE the language on someone based on REGION.  They did this for regular MC on Xbox, now I can't play it without changing my console region settings.. So.. I no longer play that game.
PS4 also want have a Chinese version many thanks

Why only PC version get Chinese support????
We NEED Chinese in SWITCH version!!!!!!! Thank you!!
Switch
Switch
This has been released for PC! We don't have a set date yet but both Traditional Chinese and Simplified Chinese text will be added to all other supported platforms.
This so nice!
I want everybody to be able to play so ya
if only we could scroll through the map to see the edges we forgot to go... that would be really helpful too!
Press down on the d-pad instead of holding it, you'll have a map overlay.
i would love that! its annoying to have a big overlay on the middle of the screen.
Also maybe an option to change the transparency level of the map overlay.
Definitely this, The full map in my screen kinda distract me while I'm playing. I also like to enjoy the scenery but hard to do with the map on my face.
I definitely think this is needed. There is real estate in top left. Once opens full map, second button press minimizes to top left or right, third button press closes.
I also think this is something needed, the overlay is incredibly distracting. I was surprised to find out there is no minimap as it's such a common feature.

Have this as an option in the gameplay section. The current overlay map being in the center sometimes is distracting, and navigation in maze like areas of tight hallways (creepy crypt) a bit harder. Having a small minimap in the top corner would be a fantastic QOL feature.
I would love to have an option to add a minimap on the screen. Keep the map overlay is annoying and switching it on and off every few seconds, is annoying also.

Mini map function is really something that should be implemented. Not only for gameplay reasons, but also for streaming/recording purposes. Very distracting for the audience to have the big map overlay across the screen. Take a page out of Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance 1+2.
I would love this.
Almost 3 years now and I can't believe this still isn't an option...
Instead of this, they need to just fix the actual problem of getting stuck due to glitches.

I would love to see this! I keep dodge rolling through walls and off cliffs and I'll get stuck out of bounds and have to leave the dungeon just to redo everything I already accomplished. It's the only reason I'll only play one dungeon a day.
Either Fix The Problem Or A Restart To Checkpoint, Pointless To Go Thru A Whole Dungeon Just To Be Stuck

Tried rolling and using different artifacts to escape a swamp area that didn't kill or respawn me. 10 minutes cause I didn't want to start all over.
I'd appreciate this simple option.
Same here, fell into a spot where there is no way to die and respawn or get out, complete bull having to restart now.
Insanely annoying, happens at least on half of my runs and have to start all over. Game wrecking bug for me, sorry.

This issue has happened most often when i'm either hitting a spring board or accidentally rolling off a ledge and getting stuck midair. This would be an amazing feature.

 

Even a "respawn" button in the menu that applies the damage from a fall and respawns you as though you fell is a minimum.

Ditto to this.  I got stuck in a level and tried to get out for about 25 minutes (25 mins ago) and couldn't get unstuck. I'm playing single player, and there's no way for me to get out.  Why not make the teleport (to another player) button be a respawn button as well?
I got once stuck in soggy swamp, but with 30 minutes of work, i got out.

I just started playing the new jungle dlc and I was nearly to the very end where the giant creeper statue is and I rolled off a hill and got stuck. I tried everything, having a respawn option in the pause menu would be a huge help considering how long some of the levels are.
same I just got stuck in a block and I almost got out by having a mob kill me but my pet kkilled it before it even hit me ;(
I had this happen while trying to unlock the secret mission in Frozen Fjord. I fell off the ship and had to replay the mission 3 times to get to the secret area again.
I have to say that MCD is turning out to be worse than Beta. So many bugs and glitches. I get stuck in geometry daily

EXTREMELY disappointed that this isn't an option yet/the developers haven't fixed the issue at all. I'm coming to this thread almost 6 months later. I'm stuck in a tree after accidentally rolling off of the top of it. Really don't want to start this over. A friend and I have been playing this level for over 40 minutes. He tried going to the edge of the map(away from me) to try getting the game to have me spawn next to him and get me out of the spot, but it just sucked him into the same spot as me and now we're both stuck. This is extremely bogus.
I struggle to see how the developers have time for DLC, but an issue that's been present since day one still goes unfixed.
Coming soon! :)
Hello gartzke how many votes do you have to have for an official comment I have submitted feedback so Im just curious.
Im stuck right at the end coming out of a 45 minute dungeon. Its infuriating. The nether update is full of stick bugs. Such a shame
Roblox-style "Reset Character" button! Nice. Also, this should be able to be disabled on the server side so that servers don't need to account for it.

Please for the love of god add this

I just had to quit the same level three times in a row because of this, I'm done with MCD for the day now, it's just really frustrating sometimes

2nd day playing game. Started playing because of the SCP content, but as I go to load new game I get  pushed something about a demigod fighting for his cloud based city.  Make it all the wY to the fox NCP fight off fire mobs. Afterwards I break the 3 purple , nothing. A brighstone appears, I break it, BOOM HIDDEN npc single square hole am now stuck. Really , several hours wasted and the thing was already buggy as hell.
Its 2022 no unstuck option is unacceptable, bet the ban account button works.
Yes please! I keep experiencing this. It's SUCH a fun mod. But to have to restart the entire game kills it.

In this years april fool update there is the room "ship" to unlock. If you fall down from the ship and have no pickaxe, Jumpboost or enough building blocks with you you are lost at the ground of this room with the doors high up. So although kinda outdated this request seems still helpful for such situations not only for external mods. Thank you for bringing "Coming soon! :)" to life after 4 years ^^

Nether DLC: weeping sorrow. the bosses in it would have to be a ghast, endermen, a swarm of piglins and hoglins, and, of course, the Wither. it would also have to include a nether fortress, a ruined portal, a bastion, and a wither skeleton base (for the wither fight)
this would be cool especially if they include the new mobs from the nether update in normal Minecraft
Probably the first 2 DLC that will be added are Nether and End

Great idea! This is a great way for Mojang to add new content to the game. There is already a ruined portal in the camp. This is also a way to add the hovering inferno from the minecon mob vote. Just an idea though
There is that incomplete portal at spawn, so here's hoping it's already in the works!

It has been found by datamining that Nether and the END are planned to come as DLC.

New mobs like Wither, wither skeleton, ghast, blaze.

Im sure Zombie pigmen/Piglins and Magma cubes will return too!
They could add end levels too while they're at it

Great idea! I think the nether level should have everything from the 1.16 update in the normal minecraft. It would be so cool to have netherite. Oh and if you have gold armor on they will be friendly. And of course the wither boss.

Maybe it could be a thing where you need to find Emeralds/A Flint n' Steel (would be an artifact) to unlock the portal at spawn.

Maybe have a Nether Camp too?

Love the Idea, and I really wanna play it, but maybe more than one level, especially with the addition of new biomes and creatures from the base game, there's a lot to explore, and I think that could be done with multiple levels.

(maybe it has a mini story where you go through, and your portal gets hit by a ghast, so you have to explore the nether to get the pieces to fix your portal and return home)
I'm pretty sure they said that a nether DLC was coming, but yes I agree that it would have so much potential!
Honestly I'm certain that mojang Is already planning on a nether DLC But better to suggest it just in case

Not sure where to put this but I wanted to say well done on the Nether update. I have been complaining for years that updates keep breaking the game for those who grind mobs and this update fixed quite a few things, thank you.

More in line with the post, if the dungeon dropped redstone that would be very helpful to survival redstone builders.
The boss would be the a netherite monstrosity and it would be 3 levels (1 secret level)and piglins can be barterd with for gold,a second currency obtained as a replacement for emeralds in the nether
Nether DLC has been confirmed to be happening by mojang.
The Nether DLC should've have the hovering inferno as the boss

The boss of the Nether DLC should be the Wither Storm. It is destructive and takes out level blocks, including portal, chest and gate blocks. It also takes in dropped items and mobs, including dropped emeralds and gold. To defeat it in Minecraft Dungeons, you should defeat it as you normally would in Story Mode, but you feed it 1000 gold instead of breaking the command block.

Hello, I too was very surpised. I have finished the game in under 3 hours and was like "this is it?". Fortunately it comes for free via Xbox game pass, but I cannot imagine my reaction if I actually bought the game.

It feels like it was made by 2 person indie developer team. I am very aware this game was not developed to compete with Diablo 3 or Path of Exile, but the whole game consists of 9 missions, one player hub and two vendors with randomly rolling items. Thats it, there is literally nothing else.

I was really looking forward for this game. I was not watching any pre-launch streams or gameplay trailers. I was not reading about the game, I was just waiting for it to be released. I cannot say I overhyped myself.

Now lets wait for Torchlight III, unless you announce any DLC that would at least tripple the content of this game. Three hours and I was done, I am not interested in trying Adventure mode, especially without matchmaking or some online elements.
I saw on the Mojang FAQ that yes, indeed, we will be receiving free updates to MCD (Minecraft Dungeons) so the game will be getting longer I believe.
The game is designed for replay ability. Mojang has already announced that free updates will be coming to the game, as well as upcoming DLC's.

Mojang follows the philosophy of getting things out to the public as quick as possible to get feedback. Much like Minecraft in the beginning the game will not have that much content. I am almost positive this game will receive constant updates and support just like Minecraft. They have already expressed the intent to do so. It will get more valuable over time. I personally think its worth the price as is. 20 dollars is not that much for a game.
Yeah, I bought it and loved it, but it is so short I almost feel ripped off. Please make it longer.

Yeah free updates is good like Normal Minecraft End/Ocean/Nether so on...

I also think its too short but I replayed the soggy swamp level like 3 times and got a new Level unlocked Swamp cave, so I think theres hidden levels to unlock. Thats why people are saying its too short because half the levels are hidden.

I think the new hidden levels should reveal themselves after you beat the game or get further into the game.

Then people wouldn't say its to short. It might be able to be fixed differently in a patch/hotfix/update. Just a tip, Mojang...
The game is getting dlc soon in July and in September

I must confess that I'm worried about the "coming soon DLC" being paid content, as the campaign took me only 6 hours at the highest difficulty with no deaths. 

The whole game is gorgeous and has loads of potential, in fact I was very surprised to see

  • There weren't more vendors
  • The village didn't repopulate as I rescued villagers
  • My house didn't get bigger or contain any more trophies as I progressed
  • The only unlocked mode at the end was "harder mode"

The way everything is set up, it makes it seem as if these things would happen, but instead the camp is just a big empty space and apparently the coolest thing to do after the campaign is play it again on the higher difficulties.

I would like to say that I got kinda dissapointed when the game finished.I saw the *spoiler alert* staff getting resurected and I just hope that there will be more updates based on this.I loved the story and the gameplay but the length of the game is very short.Please add more free content and expand the story so that people can enjoy it properly.
it's only been out for a few days just chill
I feel the SAME WAY! Please make it longer!

in compleate agreement i made my friend buy this game saying it was great buut now ive made her waste it on a few hourse of fun not happy. i was more expecting 50+ missions not 9, look all you need to do is ad a randomly generated dungeon feature for players to play through and then your done and it would be a good game that i could actully consider playing fort a long time instead of just a few hours
Pretty sure minecraft dungeons was released prematurely due to Covid-19, so give them time to bring about more content, mainly in the form of DLC.

At first glance the game appears short, and yes while you can complete the story quite quickly, its made for replayability. You are meant to go back and do more exploring and find better gear with what you want and find all the hidden nooks and crannies of the map like the secret levels. Each level is a bit different every time with the procedural generation. Plus they are expanding the game and adding new stuff. So what I'm trying to say is it is short at first glance, but there's a lot more when you take the time to explore it.
I definitely agree luckily mine was free via game pass but only 14 missions???? Sure 5 of them are secret but not hard to find.

I agree. It was way too short. I was very surprised and thought that's it??

But on the other hand, I understand if this was some sort of test to see how popular it would be and if it would sell well, like when tv-series start with only a few seasons rather than 20+ season.

But when I found out that the 2 DLC updates were only 3 missions long I was disappointed again!
I mean why bother creating something people will go through in 1 hour?

Your game is very sucessful, everyone loves it, it's even better than Diablo 3. Much better! And that's saying something!

So make huge worlds, much bigger DLC's or Expansions that add a bunch of stuff, go all in!

One thing I just thought of, what if Minecraft Dungeons could have a endless randomly generated world complete with cave entrances, crypts, temples and villages/villagers giving different quests, just start in Camp and just take off and go for a Adventure and see what you find :D I would love that, but I wonder how possible that is for them to create.
We paid 26.99 for this and it should be longer than 9 levels
Definitely too short. I feel like paying extra because of the brand, like when you buy Nike and pay lots of money for an average show.

It takes me 1-2 hours to complete a single level, but I always fully explore the levels do you just sprint through the levels, only focusing on getting closer to the objective?

Keep in mind that fully exploring allows you to sometimes unlock secret levels, Ive already found 2.

That's like beating the ender dragon in normal Minecraft and saying the game is too short. The main story is not the focus, it's the replayability. You unlock more armor, weapon, and artifact types are you complete the different difficulties. As you continue to progress, you combine different gear with different types of enchantments.
I like everything about the game and as long as they bring more levels out eventually Im happy

The point of the game is its replay ability, the story isnt the main focus. Youre meant to have to replay all of the levels many times and power up as much as possible. If anyone thinks the game is too short, then it isnt their type of game.
I think they do know this but they just wanted the game out for people to play and then they could just update more and more
Than go to the secret level

The game is very short. Completing the same mission over and over for a slightly better item with better rolls for what? There is nothing to do past main story, it just gets boring. The dlc is only 3 missions and after that wait again for dlc2 which is also 3 missions... They really need to bring big updates with a huge world and I will gladly pay for that but as it is now, way too short, game feels like a alpha not even beta lol

Lets see. There are nine levels. Each level has a secret level. There is one bonus level after unlocking secrets. 9+9+1=19. There are three difficulties. 19*3=57. So we have 57 levels, each difficulty unlocks better, newer gear. Complain about the length of the game once you have fully beat it. 
Edit: I forgot to mention that there are free updates.

I would have agreed at first, but after a few weeks, I think the game is fine as it is.
From my experience, it seems that the length of the game is between 9-13 hours to finish the default mode with exploring (4-6 hours if your only following the objective only), plus 3-4 hours for the secret levels, plus 8-12 hours for the other two difficulties but with little exploring since you already explored most of the areas in the default mode levels.

So it rounds to 21-31 hours to finish the whole game, plus the game has pretty decent replayability, I get back to the game from time to time to replay a few of my favorites levels or to try new builds.
Overall, 20$ is a good price for the game.

There are free updates, but I doubt them being more content, probably just bug fixes and quality of life features.

Hello, I just bought minecraft dungeons today and it was very difficult because i had to convince mi dad i just played for a few hours and i finished the game. I was sooooooooooooo disappointed that I can't even tell and 20$ for this isn't really worth it

So, let's suppose the game will end it's development after all the announced things are released. Very unlikely but just think about it like that.
We already get 9 levels and probably 5 secret levels right now. The next dlc announced 3 new dlc levels and 1 new free level, and we could expect 1 secret level as well (not announced but it would be very weird if they don't do that). We could expect dlc 2 to be the same. So that means the game will become 34 levels long, on par with path of exile 1.0. there's also "Island realms", which could be just a map or a new game mode. The first year can get MCD to a point where $30 become well worth it. Remember, it took Minecraft like almost 3 years to get to its first "complete" form, that is version 1.7. we definitely can wait. Plus right now it really takes almost 20 hours to find most of the secrets without looking up a walkthrough.
Mojang make the dlc's into free updates I totally agree this game is to short and I don't even play it. }:(

They defintly can make this game longer let's cross are fingers by next may there will be another dungeon and a couple more dlc's

It's been some months since the release of Minecraft Dungeons and in that time, we've added a wealth of new content to the game, both free and paid. Dungeons is a game that isn't just about completing every mission once, but building amazing characters and gear combinations to face tougher and tougher challenges. We have even more new mission based content on the the way, again, both with paid DLC and free game updates. Thanks a lot!
Quick recommendation, there are hidden runes throughout the game and a secret level after they are all collected. If the game get boring look for those.
Yes, this would be really fun. Maybe villagers would ring the bell to start a new wave?

YES! This should be a thing.
Maybe have a pretty sizeable emerald fee, since there's a reason that we can't remove enchants right now, so having a fee in place would probably work to counter act it

I completely agree, we would be able to switch with other enchantments and try different tactics much more easily without worrying a lot about what enchantments to take. We would also be able to keep the items that we like when we find a better one.

Though, it should use emeralds to remove the enchantments from the items. I would also make it two options, 1) Is to lower the level of the enchantment by one 2) Remove all the level enchantments for that enchantment.

So for example, if I have a weapon with two enchantments I will remove the first enchantment with x emeralds and lower the other enchantment by one level with x emeralds.

Also, there should be a way to display what are the other enchantments the item have before removing the enchantment. It would be useful to know if you want to change the enchantment to another one but you don't remember the enchantment on the item.
Maybe as long as you do not launch new mission. I hate that I can't test enchantments on training ground and than remove it if I do not like it.
This would be an amazing feature! I always try to use the blacksmith to remove enchantments, but he usually costs around a 1000 emeralds, and if I can't afford it, I have to salvage my gear :(
Maybe make it cost an enchantment point because that seems a bit overpowered if you've already collected a bunch of emeralds.
There is already a way to do that.

415138198671

Not a reliable one, it does help but it requires you to complete 3 levels and a lot of emeralds in order to remove the enchantments which takes a lot more time to do.

Just adding a way to remove the enchantment would help improve the game experience by a lot and I really hope it doesn't cost a lot of emeralds.
This would be a very epic feature since I normally enchant Unique items and I dont want to salvage them when I want to get more Enchantment points.
I think it would be great so if we didn't want the enchantment we could take it off!

Here's an idea: when a boss hits, let's say, 3/4 of its HP, it shows a new attack. Then at 1/2, another new attack, and same with 1/4.

Maybe the bosses summon attack gets progressively more devastating. For example: the arch illager can summon a Redstone golem, a ring of vindicators, and a line of pillagers. well, lets change the Redstone golem to only be summoned when the arch is down two-thirds of his health, he can also summon a evoker and four enchanters in the four corners of the boss arena when he is down one-third of his health, the Heart Of Ender can also summon hoards of ender mites, and their numbers go up the more health The Heart Of Ender loses.

Arch-Illager -

Spawns only vindicators, pillagers and redstone golems. How about that he can summon skeleton vanguards, redstone cubes, wraiths, slimes and cave spiders. Maybe some powerful attacks.

I made 5 posts for each non-dlc boss in Minecraft Dungeons and how to make them more interesting:

  1. Corrupted Cauldron
  2. Nameless One
  3. Redstone Monstrosity

  1. Jungle Abomination
  2. Wretched Wraith

I just fought the Ancient Guardian from the Hidden Depths DLC, and it was actually really good. It had many various attacks, but it also didn't show all of them right at the start of the battle. My favorite thing about the Ancient Guardian is that it revealed more abilities as the fight progressed, and I would love to see something like this for future bosses.
Finding via a filter would be more beneficial, but sorting by name etc could be quite handy.
Yes please. I was thinking naming items, but anything helpful for finding items that belong in builds. Its tedious when all your robes look the same.
it could let you prioritize an item if you use it a lot and it will always be at the top of the list

Would love to see sorting implementations by Name (Alphabetical), Power, Name Rarity Grouping (Alphabetical sorting but Common/Rares are paired before and with their Unique and Special Event variants also sorted in Alphabetical order. Ie:

Axe Firebrand Highland Axe Battlestaff Battlestaff of Terror Growing Staff Claymore Broadsword Great Axeblade

)

Having sorting mechanisms will assist in the navigation of the inventory on all platforms, not just on console as Flottdog shared.
This would be useful on PC as well please.
This is a much needed feature for Dungeons. I asked my wife, what's your most powerful armor and she's like 'I'll let you know in 30 min'

+1 for sorting. Please.

One of the most time-consuming tasks is finding duplicate items to make sure I keep the best one, and scrolling up and down dragging similar items together is not a fun part of the game, it's tedious admin.

I would be happy with Newest, Alphabetical, and Level, just three little buttons that affect the listing order of all of the inventory tabs.
It would also be super helpful also have a sort by power level. That way you can quickly determine which artifacts are your highest level items without scrolling through 80 items.

I had been away for several months until the new DLC dropped in late February, & I got the new season pass. It's great!

~~BUT~~

I'm finding I'm spending a lot of time hunting in the inventory for the right item with the right power level so I can maximize entering/exiting levels. I am also trying to keep enough gear so I can have a little of everything for Ancient Hunt runes, & it's really hard when there's no rhyme or reason to the sorting. That's a major drag!

Here's some ideas, all within the existing gear-type tabbed pages:

1. Sorting! let me sort items by last equipped (easy way to keep track of important items you wind up using a lot), sort by newest acquired, rarity, power, # of enchantment slots, name, attribute (speed ammo range etc) 

2. Filters! Filter by category (souls yes/no, others?), available enchantments, Ancient Hunt runes

3. Favorites! Prevent deletion, pin items. Dare I suggest gear sets?

4. Visibility: somehow inspect enchant options for an enchanted gear without removing the enchants at the Blacksmith, toggle Ancient Hunt rune visibility

In summary, we now have a 300 item inventory & we are now saving gear for Ancient Hunts we wouldn't have otherwise makes inventory management more important than ever! Even "just" the ability to sort by last equipped, by name, & time acquired would be such a quality of life improvement.

TL;DR I shouldn't have to spend that much time looking for a specific item & filters/sorts would help out a lot!

Thanks for a great game!
yes, also inventory needs zoomed in for more clear view specially when two player mode
Surprised this hasn't been implemented yet, management is incredibly annoying with all the items scattered around randomly.

This is such a standard thing to have in games with a lot of rotating loot with a power grind on top. This should have been there from day 1. As all here have already pointed out Power, alphabetical, favorite items and last used  (among others) are some of the most useful ways to cut down the unnecessary time of checking for items with the right power level.

Our family loves MC Dungeons! We really enjoy the different levels, especially the Ancient Hunts and special/seasonal challenges.  PLEASE implement an inventory sorting mechanism! That would make cleaning up the inventory much more efficient ("how many Battle Robes do I have, and which do I want to keep?"), as well as selecting items for Ancient Hunt sacrifices, upgrading at the Blacksmith, or just headed out into a level. Sorting alphabetically, by power, or commonly-used would be tremendous.  Having an option for inventory combinations (ie, soul-focused outfit, lightening-focused outfit, etc), would be a great asset also.  Thanks for such a fun game!
Being able to filter via enchantments and power level.
I think besides sorting, naming and/or labeling items could be a great way to be able to switch between different builds without having to scroll through the whole inventory (ps4 at least).

I agree, it's stupid that our arrows suddenly disappear while we get to keep everything else. Also should be able to buy arrow bundles from villager merchants.

If this is fixed, then I believe full archer builds will be possible
And maybe be able to buy arrows at your camp for emeralds?

That would make possible to farm arrows, which would get you endless arrows, so it's a big no-no-no. What they could do is remove the arrows feature and just let your bow fire forever. However, you have limited arrows for a reason. Fighting from afar is a lot easier than fighting hand-to-hand. And there are already equipment and enchantments that allow you to get more arrows in your dungeon runs.

Also arrows should stop changing rarity based in the bow equipped. Players should deal with the consequences of having a bow that's too slow/fast.

But Layla Mon actually has a good point. Collecting too many arrows can be overpowered. I think this can be solved by adding a cap to the amount of arrows a player can carry (like 1024 or 999).

Full ranged builds or close to it are possible, but harder to do.

A good way to make it easier would be to reduce the cooldown on some skills (down to 15 or 20 sec instead of 30 sec, not sure of the right number). That way you don't need as much Cooldown reduction. And if the cooldown is lower then you can use flaming quiver and fireworks arrow more often which is easier on arrows comsuption considering these skill don't use the "arrow count". Also Infinity enchant affect these skill which helps a lot too.

Torment quiver is diffrent because you mostly need a melee weapon to regain souls. Infinity enchant isn't even needed unless (maybe) if you can't gain souls fast enough. 

If you go for an hybrid build, in general  Infinity enchant will be 95% of the time more than enough. That said I dunno if by design the devs expect people to use a bit of melee and a bit of ranged attacks.

As it been said ranged can be really powerfull, 100% cooldown reduction + firecracker skill and a multishot crossbow (Harp)  and you are good to go. It's powerfull to the point where you wonder if that should exist.

And from what i've seen Torment Quiver is really good too just look for "Minecraft Dungeon OP Cleave Build Showcase" on youtube. The build could be more powerfull with a good Splending Robe (+50% artifact damage) but his build is nicely done.
its a good idea I find myself frustrated some times by my lake of arrows, but there would have to be a cap at like 500 or something.
No that would make the game completely unbalanced.

There should at least be a pattern or a cap on the arrows.  I just finished a run with close to 1,000 arrows.  Back at camp I am down to 80.  If I tried really hard to use my melee weapon in this dungeon knowing that I need the long-range capabilities in the next dungeon, I should be able to keep at least half of them...
This is absolutely annoying! I finish usually with 300+ arrows and to see all that work disappear is upsetting. Maybe Cap arrows at 1,500 which would be a good middle ground.
I agree with this post.
